page.title: 06A COAL MINE NEAR BALSALL
page.content: On the 6th of June 1985,the National Coal Board published a proposal to build a large Coalmine close to the village of Balsall Common.It could be one of the largest coalfields in the country. Although it is not in our block it still effects us.There have been two public meetings to protest about it. We went to the village and asked people about it. Most people did not want the coalmine close to them. Many were worried that the prices of their houses would drop in value. People were worried about the increased number of lorries and cars on the roads. We asked one old lady would it spoil the village, and she said that in her view "It was already spoilt to the way she knew it." by Rachel Dodd, Jonathan Moore and Katie Powell.
